Experience

Being in a cooperative educational university program, I have the opportunity to be in the workforce every other four months. I love to take on new innovating opportunities to apply my skills in a professional environment and develop myself as an engineer. Here are my past coop positions as well as other experience I have been able to take part in.

Process Engineer Co-op Student - BWXT

  • In my first co-op position, I collected data to assist in a $140-million nuclear project
  • This massive project involved shifting 480 off balanced fuel channels back into place in the core of Bruce Power's Unit 3 nuclear reactor
  • I played a key role in this process as I helped develop the software the company was using to collect data, which ultimately reduced the amount of time the reactor was shut off
  • Extensive preparation and data analysis was needed prior to fuel channel shifting to ensure everything ran optimally (Each minute the data helped save, Bruce Power recovered $2000 from the reactor being powered back on)

January 2021 - April 2021

Hyperloop Motor Developer - Waterloop

  • To keep myself occupied when I have spare time, I am currently on a university design team that is designing and constructing a hyperloop that will revolutionize the future of transportation
  • My role on this team is to help develop the linear induction motor (LIM) used to propel and levitate the hyperloop pod
  • I help test the properties of multiple LIM's using actual prototypes we create and a software called COMSOL Multiphysics
  • These prototypes are designed in SolidWorks alongside additional devices required to power the LIM
  • The overall hyperloop our team designs is put to the test in annual SpaceX competitions

January 2021 - Present

Swimming Instructor - Town of Milton

  • While studying in high school I worked part time as a swimming instructor teaching people of all ages how to swim and survive in water
  • Each shift, I had the oppurtunity to teach 8 different classes comprised of 5 to 10 students or 1 student who required special assistance
  • Ontop of teaching classes, I publicized safety standards to everyone in and around the pool and was ready to support in any injuries/accidents that could have occured
  • After teaching my classes a total of 10 times, I wrote personalized report cards tailored to each student using the detailed notes I took on the spreadsheets I created

August 2018 - March 2020

Karate Assistant Instructor - Fighting Griffin

  • During my 13 year long journey to obtain my black belt in Gōjū-ryū karate, I had the opportunity to help the higher ranked black belts teach the fundamentals of martial arts
  • Once I passed the black belt test and recieved my belt, I taught classes of 25 students developing their karate techniques
  • I also helped students individually to improve on specific areas that needed some extra practice
  • Being an avid member of the dojo, I organized and ran club wide events such as parties, summer camps, and karate tournaments whenever I had spare time

October 2016 - March 2020
